Particle Tracker¶

This is how you use the ParticleTracker class

class particle_tracker_one_d.ParticleTracker(frames, time)[source]¶

Dynamic Particle tracker object which finds trajectories in the frames. Trajectories are automatically updated when properties are changed.

Parameters
frames: np.array

The frames in which trajectories are to be found. The shape of the np.array should be (nFrames,xPixels). The intensity of the frames should be normalised according to \(I_n = (I-I_{min})/(I-I_{max})\), where \(I\) is the intensity of the frames, \(I_{min}\), \(I_{max}\) are the global intensity minima and maxima of the frames.

time: np.array

The corresponding time of each frame.

Attributes
association_matrix
boxcar_width

Number of values used in the boxcar averaging of the frames.

feature_point_threshold

Threshold for finding intensity peaks.

frames

The frames which the particle tracker tries to find trajectories in.

integration_radius_of_intensity_peaks

Number of pixels used when integrating the intensity peaks.

maximum_distance_a_particle_can_travel_between_frames
maximum_number_of_frames_a_particle_can_disappear_and_still_be_linked_to_other_particles
particle_discrimination_threshold
particle_positions
sigma_0
sigma_2
time
trajectories

Methods

get_intensity_at_time

normalise_intensity

plot_averaged_intensity

plot_intensity_at_time

plot_intensity_of_frame
property boxcar_width¶

Number of values used in the boxcar averaging of the frames.

property feature_point_threshold¶

Threshold for finding intensity peaks. Local maximas below this threshold will not be considered as particles.

property frames¶

The frames which the particle tracker tries to find trajectories in. If the property boxcar_width!=0 it will return the smoothed frames.

property integration_radius_of_intensity_peaks¶

Number of pixels used when integrating the intensity peaks. No particles closer than twice this value will be found. If two peaks are found within twice this value, the one with highest intensity moment will be kept.
